intro: Pycreus cuanzensis, commonly known as the Guangzhen lily, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking white and purple flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
